page.title: 09HISTORIC HOUSES IN HARVEL
page.content: This area has a high proportion of houses over 150 years old and several are listed as being of special historic interest. Several of these are timber-framed farmhouses and date back to the 14th and 15th Century(e.g. Boughurst, Swanswood, Famescott and Combehill). They have enormous inglenook fireplaces and are either peg-tiled or thatched. Forge Cottage dates back to 1590 and was the village pub until 1914. There are several conversions into interesting homes,for example in Harvel there are two C19 oast houses,the old school and a timber-framed barn. The attractive features of C18-19 houses include white-washed plasterwork,flint walling, carved brickwork and clapboarding.
